Question: Write mp3 file to disk while playing in Java: :I have an application playing remote MP3 files over HTTP using the JLayer/BasicPlayer libraries. I want to save the played mp3 files to disk without re-downloading them.This is the code using the JLayer based BasicPlayer for Playing the MP3 file.String mp3Url = "http://ia600402.us.archive.org/6/items/Stockfinster.-DeadLinesutemos025/01_Push_Push.mp3";URL url = new URL(mp3Url);URLConnection conn = url.openConnection();InputStream is = conn.getInputStream();BufferedInputStream bis = new BufferedInputStream(is);BasicPlayer player = new BasicPlayer();player.open(bis);player.play();How would I save the mp3 file to disk?
Please using this api: InputStream.read.
Answer:
response:
<<<api>>>: InputStream.read.
<<<code>>>: InputStream.read.
<<<explanation>>>: InputStream.read.
Question: How to get the current time in milliseconds in Java: :I want to get the current time in milliseconds in Java.
Please use the System.currentTimeMillis() method.
Answer: <<<api>>>: System.currentTimeMillis().
<<<code>>>: System.currentTimeMillis().
<<<explanation>>>: System.currentTimeMillis().
Question: How to get the current time in milliseconds in Java: :I want to get the current time in milliseconds in Java. I have tried the System.currentTimeMillis() method but it is returning the time in seconds.
Please use the System.currentTimeMillis() method. It returns the current time in milliseconds.
Answer: <<<api>>>: System.currentTimeMillis().
<<<code>>>: System.currentTimeMillis().
<<<explanation>>>: System.currentTimeMillis().
Question: How to get the current time in milliseconds in Java: :I want to get the current time in milliseconds in Java. I have tried the System.currentTimeMillis() method but it is returning the time in seconds. I want to get the time in milliseconds.
Please use the System.currentTimeMillis() method. It returns the current time in milliseconds. You can use the following code to get the current time in milliseconds:
long currentTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
